com.hazelcast.nio.tcp

Interface SocketWriter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NonBlockingSocketWriter, SpinningSocketWriter

    public interface SocketWriter
    Each TcpIpConnection has a SocketWriter and it writes OutboundFrame instances to the socket. Copying the Frame instances to the byte-buffer is done using the WriteHandler. Each TcpIpConnection has its own SocketWriter instance. Before Hazelcast 3.6 the name of this interface was WriteHandler.
    See Also:
    SocketReader, ReadHandler, IOThreadingModel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes this SocketWriter.
      long getLastWriteTimeMillis()
      Returns the last Clock.currentTimeMillis() that a write to the socket completed.
      WriteHandler getWriteHandler()
      Gets the WriteHandler that belongs to this SocketWriter.
      void setProtocol(String protocol)
      Sets the protocol this SocketWriter should use.
      int totalFramesPending()
      Returns the total number of packets (urgent and non normal priority) pending to be written to the socket.
      void write(OutboundFrame frame)
      Offers a Frame to be written to the socket.

    • Method Detail

      • totalFramesPending

        int totalFramesPending()
        Returns the total number of packets (urgent and non normal priority) pending to be written to the socket.
        Returns:
        total number of pending packets.

      • getLastWriteTimeMillis

        long getLastWriteTimeMillis()
        Returns the last Clock.currentTimeMillis() that a write to the socket completed. Writing to the socket doesn't mean that data has been send or received; it means that data was written to the SocketChannel. It could very well be that this data is stuck somewhere in an io-buffer.
        Returns:
        the last time something was written to the socket.

      • write

        void write(OutboundFrame frame)
        Offers a Frame to be written to the socket. No guarantees are made that the frame is going to be written or received by the other side.
        Parameters:
        frame - the Frame to write.

      • getWriteHandler

        WriteHandler getWriteHandler()
        Gets the WriteHandler that belongs to this SocketWriter. This method exists for the TextReadHandler, but probably should be deleted.
        Returns:
        the WriteHandler

      • setProtocol

        void setProtocol(String protocol)
        Sets the protocol this SocketWriter should use. This should be called only once at the beginning of the connection. See Protocols
        Parameters:
        protocol - the protocol

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this SocketWriter. This method can be called from an arbitrary thread, and should only be called once. This should be coordinated through the TcpIpConnection.close(String, Throwable) method.
